home-hero.text1: Digital parking disc - directly on your mobile.
home-hero.text2: A winning concept in a new, digitalized format.

how.headline: How It Works
how.text1: Open the app, register with your license plate number.
how.text2: Use the map, search function, or zone list to find your parking spot.
how.text3: Once you've found your parking zone, you can review parking rules, start parking, and close the app.

smart-parking.headline: Smart Parking Solution
smart-parking.text1: The parking disc has long been a tool to promote circulation and activity in city centers. It's a fantastic invention that benefits residents, visitors, and local businesses alike. We want to be part of this evolution by creating a free digital parking disc.
smart-parking.bullet1: We aim to support the growth and efficiency of urban areas.
smart-parking.bullet2: Our digital parking disc simplifies the parking process.
smart-parking.bullet3: Any parking attendant systems can easily be integrated with our system.
smart-parking.text2: We're excited to share more about our solution in a meeting.

contact.text1: Whether you have a question, feedback, or need assistance, please fill out the form below, and our team will get back to you as soon as possible.
contact.name: First and Last Name
contact.title: Job Title

why.headline: Why Parking Time?
why.text1: Our digital solution attracts more visitors by eliminating physical discs and reducing fines. This simplifies parking, boosts foot traffic, economic activity, and city vibrancy while reducing stress.
why.text2: Our app lets you effortlessly set, adjust, and monitor parking time. With a user-friendly interface, you can quickly find spots and manage parking. We continuously update based on customer feedback to ensure an efficient and hassle-free experience.
why.text3: Our system for parking attendants integrates seamlessly with your existing setup. A unified system benefits you by streamlining operations and enhancing the experience for personnel by eliminating the need for two different systems and devices. We make this integration efficient, intuitive, and simple!
why.text4: The digital parking disc can eventually optimize parking resources and urban planning through valuable usage data and behavior patterns, leading to a safer society with better control and access to parking spaces.

PrivacyTextContent.text-base: This policy applies to all websites of Parking Time Sweden AB. The personal data policy applies to Parking Time in connection with services and products related to purchases, customer service issues, other contact with Parking Time, as well as visits to the website. Your personal data is important to us.
PrivacyTextContent.personal_data: Your personal data is important to us
PrivacyTextContent.personal_data-text: Parking Time collects and processes personal data about you when you visit or make a purchase on any of our websites or contact Parking Time via email or social media. Parking Time is committed to protecting your privacy and strives for a high level of data protection. This privacy policy explains why and how we collect and use your personal information. It also describes your rights and how you can exercise them. It is important to us that the personal data you entrust to us as a customer and reader is handled carefully, responsibly, transparently, and legally.
PrivacyTextContent.Text1: Who is responsible for the data we collect?
PrivacyTextContent.Text2: Parking Time Sweden AB is responsible for the processing of your personal data by Parking Time and ensures that such processing is conducted in accordance with applicable legislation.
PrivacyTextContent.Text4: Personal data is any type of information that can be directly or indirectly attributed to a living individual. Examples of personal data are names, email addresses, phone numbers, and personal identification numbers. Images and audio recordings are also considered personal data even if no names are mentioned. Encrypted data and various electronic identities (such as IP addresses) are also considered personal data if they can be linked to physical individuals.
PrivacyTextContent.Text5: Where do your personal data come from?
PrivacyTextContent.Text6: The primary source of personal data about you is you, such as the information you provide when you register for a subscription, contact us via email, and receive/respond to email communication. Personal data is also created as a result of you reading information on our website, using services, and communicating with us. For example, we may save visitor, traffic, and other communication data. Examples of such personal data include your IP address. This data is collected via cookies and is used to better understand you so that we can target relevant information to you. To do this, we need your consent, which you give by accepting cookies when you visit our website.
PrivacyTextContent.Text7: Where does Parking Time get information for parking zones?
PrivacyTextContent.Text8: Parking Time Sweden AB presents parking zones in the app. Information about the parking zones comes from the municipalities that use the app. The data is imported from the municipalities' own parking maps, such as the parking zones of Katrineholm municipality here. Parking Time Sweden AB is an independent limited company and does not represent any government authority.
PrivacyTextContent.Text9: Personal data we collect about you if we need them
PrivacyTextContent.Text12: User's GPS location at the time of parking.
PrivacyTextContent.Text13: Contact information (address, email, and phone number).
PrivacyTextContent.Text15: It is possible to track a user's browsing activity with a cookie. Cookies are used to give you, as a visitor, access to various functions and to customize content in newsletters. We use cookies to tailor the content of our advertising. We also use cookies on our website to collect statistics on how much the web is used. A cookie is a text file saved on your device so that the website can recognize your device. This cookie contains no personal information. There are two types of cookies: permanent and temporary (so-called session cookies). Permanent cookies are stored as a file on your device for a longer period, while session cookies are temporarily placed on your device and are only used while you are browsing the website. They are deleted afterward. If you want to know when your device receives a cookie, you can set your browser to notify you. This way, you have the option to accept or reject a cookie. Your device can also be set to reject all cookies. Note that if you choose not to accept cookies, some features of our online services may no longer work as intended.
PrivacyTextContent.Text16: Special considerations for consent to direct marketing
PrivacyTextContent.Text17: Provided that you have given us your explicit consent, we will continuously send and publish information and marketing via various digital channels based on your profile. You may opt out of receiving marketing communications from us at any time by clicking 'unsubscribe' in the email or SMS communication that we send you. You can also contact Parking Time via email at matildaohman@parkingtime.se for assistance in declining our communication.
PrivacyTextContent.Text18: How long do we keep your information?
PrivacyTextContent.Text19: Your personal data is stored only as long as there is a need to retain them to fulfill the purposes for which the data was collected. Parking Time may keep the data longer if needed to comply with legal requirements or to protect Parking Time's legal interests, such as during a legal process.
PrivacyTextContent.Text20: Who can we share your personal data with?
PrivacyTextContent.Text21: Your personal data may be shared with other companies. These are Parking Time's data processors. A data processor is a company that processes information on our behalf and according to our instructions. Parking Time's data processors perform services on our behalf, such as sending newsletters or delivering ordered goods. All disclosures will be made in accordance with the law, and your personal data will not be used for other purposes than those we have informed you about. We have written agreements with all data processors through which they guarantee the security of the personal data processed and commit to following our security requirements as well as restrictions and requirements regarding international transfer of personal data. When your personal data is shared with a company that is an independent data controller, the counterparty's privacy policy and data processing apply. We share your personal data with certain companies that are independent data controllers. Examples of independent data controllers with whom we share your personal data are:
PrivacyTextContent.Text22: Government authorities in case of suspected crime.
PrivacyTextContent.Text23: Where do we process your personal data?
PrivacyTextContent.Text24: We always strive to ensure that your personal data is processed within the EU/EEA, and all our own IT systems are within the EU/EEA.
PrivacyTextContent.Text26: According to EU data protection legislation, you have certain statutory rights as an individual concerning the personal data we process about you. If you encounter information about yourself or close individuals that you for some reason do not want to be published on Parking Time's website, we appreciate if you contact us via email at matildaohman@parkingtime.se.
PrivacyTextContent.Text27: You also have the right to file a complaint with the national data protection authority, the Data Protection Authority, if you believe that our processing of your personal data does not meet the requirements of EU data protection legislation.
PrivacyTextContent.Text28: Access to your personal data: You have the right to access your personal data and how they are processed. Correction, deletion, or restriction: You have the right to correct data that you believe is incorrect. In certain cases, you also have the right to have your personal data deleted. However, this does not apply if your personal data still needs to be retained, for example, if the law requires us to store the data or if the data is needed to fulfill a contract we have with you. You also have the right to request that the processing of personal data be restricted for a short period while we investigate any inaccuracies. Withdrawal of consent: If you have given consent to certain processing, you always have the right to withdraw your consent.
PrivacyTextContent.Text29: Objection regarding balance of interests: When processing is based on a so-called balance of interests, you have the right to object to the processing at any time. Objection to direct marketing: You have the right to object to the processing of personal data concerning you for direct marketing purposes at any time. In such cases, the personal data should no longer be processed for such purposes. Data portability: You have the right to data portability, which means that in certain circumstances, you have the right to receive the personal data you have provided to us, to be able to transfer the data to another data controller.
PrivacyTextContent.Text31: If you wish to exercise any of your statutory rights, please send a written and personally signed request to the address provided below. You can also always contact Parking Time via our website if you have any questions regarding the processing of your personal data. We will respond in writing to your registered address. You can also contact Parking Time for any comments or complaints about how we handle your personal data via email at matildaohman@parkingtime.se.
PrivacyTextContent.Text35: Purpose and legal basis for processing your personal data
PrivacyTextContent.Text36: The processing of your personal data serves specific purposes, based on legal grounds described below. Additionally, we clarify how your personal data is processed for parking purposes.
PrivacyTextContent.Text37: Fulfillment of orders for services and subscriptions
PrivacyTextContent.Text38: Legal basis: Performance of a contract you are a party to.
PrivacyTextContent.Text40: After your consent, we send newsletters.
PrivacyTextContent.Text42: Consent from you for this type of processing.
PrivacyTextContent.Text45: Handling inquiries directed to Parking Time via
PrivacyTextContent.Text47: or to other responsible persons at Parking Time, received via email, phone, or digital channels, including all social platforms.
PrivacyTextContent.Text50: Handling complaints received via email, phone, or other digital channels, including social media.
PrivacyTextContent.Text52: Performance of a contract you are a party to.
PrivacyTextContent.Text55: Use of your transactions for our accounting and reporting purposes.
PrivacyTextContent.Text56: Legal basis: Fulfillment of legal obligations.
PrivacyTextContent.Text57: For each purpose, a distinct legal basis is identified to ensure compliance with relevant legal requirements. These purposes are clearly delineated to facilitate transparency and accountability in the processing of personal data by Parking Time Sweden AB.
